revised_title: On the Origin of Air Disengaged from the Sea Over Sunken Volcanoes
tldr: The author investigates the origin of air disengaged from the sea over sunken volcanoes and argues that it is derived from the water, rather than a deep volcanic source. The author suggests that the expulsion of air from the water is due to the heat of the ocean floor and the attraction of iron oxide, which removes oxygen from the air.
